intro: Diodia scandens, commonly known as creeping dill. It is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States, characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and carrots. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Diodia scandens thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
